title: No longer able to accept meeting invitations sent by email (and no longer added to my calendar)
content: Up to a few days ago, when someone sent me a meeting invitation by email, I could accept it on my Thunderbird email app (on my windows 11 laptop) and it would be added to my Thunderbird calendar. When I would open an email invitation, there was always a line/bar that would appear below the subject line that would say "this message contains an invitation to an event" on the left side and then buttons with "accept" "tentative" "decline" on the right side of that line. This line/bar no long appears in email event/meeting invitations. On my windows 11 Laptop with Thunderbird version 128.2.1esr (64) bit, that line/bar no longer appears and I can no longer accept event/meeting requests sent to me by email. I could do this before, and I have an example from my old windows 10 laptop using Thunderbird version 115.15.0 (32 bit). Did something change with a new Thunderbird update? Or do I need to change some setting in my Thunderbird version 128.2.1esr (64 bit) app? See attached example of meeting requests received by email on both versions of Thunderbird. The email from the 115 version shows that event line/bar the email from the 128 version doesn't. Any advice? Thanks in advance.
creator: jaywhyvanier

title: Starting Thunderbird is extremely slow
content: Hello, I recently bought a MacBook Air 2024 with G3 chip (Sonoma 14.6.1) and used Time Machine to transfer all the data from my previous Apple MacBook Air from 2015 (Mojave 10.14.6) to the new computer. This also transferred my Thunderbird profile folder. It has the extension .default and an 8-digit combination of letters and numbers in front of it. Since the old version of Thunderbird no longer ran on Sonoma, I installed Thunderbird 115.15.0 and then opened Thunderbird on the new MacBook Air. Since then, Thunderbird has been taking an extremely long time to open (much longer than on the old MacBook Air with Mojave. Yesterday I updated to 128.2.0esr, which didn't help either. I deleted a deactivated extension in the add-ons, so that there are now no extensions, only a few dictionaries that I deleted as a test, which also did not bring any improvement. Switching off the hardware acceleration, clearing the cache and changing the themes did not improve the situation either. With the themes, I can only switch between dark, light and system theme - automatically. I checked and made sure that Thunderbird actually loads the .default profile folder from my old computer as the active profile. However, Thunderbird has also automatically set up a second profile with the extension .default-release. Could this be causing the problem? My active profile folder has a size of 15.21 GB and the new .deault-release profile folder has 18.6 MB. Both profile folders are located in Library/Thunderbird/Profiles I am quite desperate and hope that someone can help me. Thank you very much!
creator: buy9

title: Too many redirects for caldata
content:
Hi,

Mozilla Thunderbird graciously provides online calendars for holidays in different countries.

However, since last check (possible since a few days), there seems to be a configuration error:

https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/DutchHolidays.ics redirects to: https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/autogen/DutchHolidays.ics which redirects to: https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/autogen/autogen/autogen/DutchHolidays.ics which redirects to: https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/DutchHolidays.ics which redirects to: https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/DutchHolidays.ics which redirects to: https://www.thunderbird.net/media/caldata/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/autogen/DutchHolidays.ics which redirects to ....

Well, you get the drift :)

Firefox is giving me a warning "The page isn’t redirecting properly. An error occurred during a connection to www.thunderbird.net. "

Please test yourself in Firefox. If the error is still there, please kindly forward it to the thunderbird.net webmaster. If the error is no longer there, it was fixed, and you can close this ticket.

Thanks again for providing this service, I'll look forward to continued use!
creator: macfreek

title: Issues Connecting Thunderbird with Outlook (UNED)
content:
Dear all,

I am experiencing an issue while trying to connect Thunderbird (v. 128.2.0esr 64-bit, Linux Mint 22) to Outlook provided by my university (UNED). I receive the error message "user is authenticated but not connected." I have already tried disabling IPv6, but that no longer seems to work.

Using the Microsoft Remote Connectivity Analyzer, I verified that the Outlook Connectivity test works correctly. However, both the POP3 and IMAP tests do not work. For instance, the IMAP test provides the following output:

title: Not able to send email; receiving OK
content: Thanks for listening: Last week, Thunderbird began returning this message with each attempt to send mail: An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: <tedcomo@chartertn.net> sender rejected. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again. I have no problem receiving mail. At the same time, my wife began having the same problem on her laptop, which tells me either Charter, or Mozilla, changed something. I started with Charter. They told me to rename both servers to mobile.charter.net (outgoing mail was formerly smpt.charter.net. No effect. They then had me log into Spectrum and send a test mail directly from my account. It went through OK and they said the problem had to be on Mozilla's end. Any suggestions?

title: Misplaced inbox during xfer
content: While transferring Mozilla Thunderbird from my old MAC computer (OS 10.11, TB 78.14) to my new MAC computer (OS 12.7.6, TB 128.1.1) everything went well except that the “inbox” for 2 of my main accounts were not placed at the top of the left hand column with my other account inboxes. I found them in the account “envelopes” at the bottom of that left hand column. 1. How can I move them back to the top of the left column under the “main general inbox”? 2. How can I reorder these inboxes so that my main inboxes are at the top? Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks.
creator: har-ros

title: no longer receiving emails on one of my email addresses
content: Although OK 2 days ago, I am no longer receiving emails on one of my email addresses Instead, I am asked for a new password. I would certainly do that but I don't know how. Google tells me to click om the hamburger icon and then how to get to "saved passwords". But when I click on "show Passwords", thinking I might be able to change an email PW there, I am asked to verify my identity and provide a password. I haven't a clue what password is wanted here. My simple Thunderbird PW I set up many years ago does not work. So how do I change my Password for my Email address that no longer works?
creator: doschneid

title: URL as requested by David
content: Hi, just asked how to create distribution lists (mailing lists) David responded with the solution and asked for the URL I was refering to so it could be corrected. Not sure how else to get it to him so here it is. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-create-and-use-mailing-lists-thunderbird#w_create-a-mailing-list
